subject: Education
title: Procedural Memory: The Body Remembers
description: A short lesson to help you apply Procedural Memory: The Body Remembers.

hook.text: You haven't ridden a bike in years. You hop on and ride perfectly. How?

buildup.text: Procedural memory stores motor skills and habits in the cerebellum and basal ganglia.

discovery.text: Unlike declarative memory, procedural memory is hard to describe but nearly impossible to forget.

twist.text: Amnesia patients who can't remember breakfast can still play piano from muscle memory.

climax.text: This is why practice makes permanent‚Äîonce a skill is procedural, it runs automatically.

punchline.text: Your body remembers what your mind has long forgotten.

quiz.question: What makes procedural memory different from declarative memory?
options: It stores motor skills that are nearly impossible to forget but hard to describe
It only stores memories from childhood
It requires conscious effort to retrieve
